thread.title_full: Sorry Coronation Street fans, tonight’s episode has been dropped – and Emmerdale is moving too

author: Duncan Lindsay
title: Sorry Coronation Street fans, tonight’s episode has been dropped – and Emmerdale is moving too
text:
(Picture: ITV) Sorry to be the bearer of bad news, Coronation Street fans but if you were hoping to settle down for your Wednesday Weatherfield fix tonight, you will be met by horrifying scenes of SPORT on ITV instead. 
Yep, Corrie has been shifted to be replaced by the Germany v England international football match, meaning a wait until Friday to find out what comes next on the cobbles.
For viewers who also watch EastEnders, this is an all too regular occurrence, as the BBC soap has been moved around to accommodate sport a number of times recently. There is also disruption to Emmerdale tonight, although there is still an episode which will air at the earlier time of 6:45pm.

Coronation Street often airs an additional episode on Thursdays so it’s likely that fans have already been paid back for this week’s missing episode but fear not, Corrie will soon be permanently upgraded to six visits a week meaning more action on the Street than ever before.
Speaking of which, the soap is about to become even more unmissable with huge storylines ahead for the Barlows as well as the return of Rob Donovan , a blast from the past for Sally and the next stage in killer Phelan’s plot .
Just not tonight. Sorry.
Coronation Street continues on Friday 24th March at 7:30pm and 8:30pm. Emmerdale continues on Wednesday 22nd March at 6:45pm. Both air on ITV. 
MORE: Coronation Street spoilers: Phelan’s next victim? The killer attacks Todd Grimshaw 
MORE: Coronation Street spoilers: The Barlow family is destroyed in dramatic scenes
